intro: Erigeron carringtoniae, commonly known as the Carrington's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert environments. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron carringtoniae is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
